comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: John Bernard "Hans" Lobert (October 18, 1881 – September 14, 1968), major league infielder, manager and scout, here shown at the beginning of his three seasons as the New York Giants' third baseman, in 1915. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hans_Lobert "When Connie Mack died in 1956, Hans Lobert became the man who had been in major-league baseball longer than anybody else. He continued to scout and work as an instructor for the Giants until his death in Philadelphia at age 87 on September 14, 1968." sabr.org/bioproj/person/1b9e4885
